altIdentifier.idno: This is not in fact Morley Handwritten Catalogue No 223, which is Codrington/Reade No 331. 331 is on the replaced spine of the binding by mistake. A pencilled addition to the Handwritten Catalogue gives it the number 223a but has confused the dates of the two copies of the 'Iyar-i Danish.

msItem.title: 'Iyar-i Danish
msItem.note: F1a: a) Signature of Jno Romer IMS? b) Stamp, the name filled in ink: Presented to the ROYAL ASIATIC SOCIETY by John Romer Esq Folio following text, verso: copy of a Persian letter. A reworking of the Kalilah wa Dimnah, on the basis of the versions of Nasrullah Munshi and Kashifi. Headings and punctuation in red.

listBibl.bibl: For the provenance see Donations Register for November 18 1848.

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather binding with blind-stamped decoration, the spine replaced and tooled with title etc, including the wrong Nos: Codrington 331, for 330 and Morley MS Catalogue 223 (for the dubious 223a - see below).

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
